content.description:
This is a place holder to de-mystify the fabled routes along the eastern shore of Laberge. It's true what they say, there are a handfull of fully equiped sport routes here ranging from 5.8 - 5.13; most of which, are in the 5.11-5.12 range. Some are steep jug hauls similar to what you find at Red River Gorge. The hard ones are thin slab mind-bottlers (when your brain gets stuck in a bottle).   
  
 There are lots of places for FA's and trad multi-pitch repeats along the shoreline. Trad teams will find decent limestone cracks to plug gear in wherever they  can conceive. Rumors say that mythic 6-pitch trad routes exist at the north end of the lake, near the mouth of the Yukon River
